The Buddha spoke this verse.
This is what he said:
“Not to ascetics or brahmins,
Not to the poor or the destitute,🔽But to those who ask, he shares what he has:
Food and drink, and also clothing.
He is said to be like a cloud that rains everywhere,
And is called the worst of men.🔽He gives to some,
But not to others.
He’s called a local shower,
say the wise.
A person who speaks of good fortune,
who has compassion for all beings,
who encourages, saying,
“Give, give!”
